trans-unit.source: Delete one or more files.

seg-source.mrk: Delete one or more files.

target.mrk: Delete one or more files.

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: The path of the file(s) to delete. (* and ? wildcards accepted - See Remarks)

seg-source.mrk: The path of the file(s) to delete.
(* and ?
wildcards accepted - See Remarks)

target.mrk: The path of the file(s) to delete.
(* and ?
wildcards accepted - See Remarks)

trans-unit.source: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: 0 if files are not deleted or do not exist.

seg-source.mrk: 0 if files are not deleted or do not exist.

target.mrk: 0 if files are not deleted or do not exist.

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: See FileFindFirstFile() for a discussion about wildcards.

seg-source.mrk: See FileFindFirstFile() for a discussion about wildcards.

target.mrk: See FileFindFirstFile() for a discussion about wildcards.

trans-unit.source: Note: If the "path" passed to FileDelete() is a folder, the files therein will be deleted just as if you had used the *.* mask.

seg-source.mrk: Note:
If the "path" passed to FileDelete() is a folder, the files therein will be deleted just as if you had used the *.* mask.

target.mrk: Note:
If the "path" passed to FileDelete() is a folder, the files therein will be deleted just as if you had used the *.* mask.

trans-unit.source: Some file attributes can make the deletion impossible, if this is the case look at FileSetAttrib() to change the attributes of a file.

seg-source.mrk: Some file attributes can make the deletion impossible, if this is the case look at FileSetAttrib() to change the attributes of a file.

target.mrk: Some file attributes can make the deletion impossible, if this is the case look at FileSetAttrib() to change the attributes of a file.
